column4: Does anyone know how to check which version of Java I have installed?
I need JRE5 for BlueJ, and I don't know if it's installed or not.
I have a file called jdk-1_5_0_15-nb-6_0_1-linux-ml.sh
That just tells me my runtime environment.
but you'll be better off installign it from a package
I recommend: sudo apt-get install sun-java5-jdk
it's nearly always better to install an ubuntu package than to download from a website and install yourself
there's also a package for java6 if you'd prefer.
No good. It won't work with my assignments.
ok, then there is java5, which is what I just told you.
make sure you have multiverse enabled.
